name: operation, reefer, cooling, 40-foot, high-cube, R134a as refrigerant | operation, reefer, cooling | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13188/documentation

This dataset represents operation of a reefer, intermodal shipping container. This datasets represents 1kg of cargo being stored in a container with a certain controlled atmosphere (temperature, humidity, air flow, etc.) for 1 day. Reefer can operate in two basic modes; cooling (temperatures between 0째C and 20째C) and freezing (temperatures between -35째C and -18째C). This dataset represents cooling.;The emissions from a transport carying the container are reported in the transport dataset.;The operation of such reefer depends heavily on type of goods being transported. This is a parametrized dataset (all parametres determining the elementary and intermediate exchanges of the activity are entered as parametres). The default parametres are set to represent average refrigerated storage. If specific cargo is being transported the parametres need to be adjusted accordingly. In general fruits, vegetables and flowers are being cooled during its transport and meat and seafood is frozen during its transport. ;The 40-foot container has a capacity of 2TEU. ;This reefer is using R134a as refrigerant.
category: H:Transportation and storage/52:Warehousing and support activities for transportation/522:Support activities for transportation/5229:Other transportation support activities

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The most used refrigerant in refrigeration machines is the R134a. Since this refrigerant has a high global warming potential the refrigeration technology producers started producing referigeration machines with alternative refrigerants (Carrier, 2014, http://dms.hvacpartners.com//docs/2000/Public/0D/62-11665.pdf, accessed 20141105). One of them is liquid carbon dioxide.

flow.name: operation, reefer, cooling
flow.category: H:Transportation and storage/52:Warehousing and support activities for transportation/522:Support activities for transportation/5229:Other transportation support activities

exchanges.description:
Calculated value.

It is estimated, that the reefer is carying only 70% of its maximal payload.

While the containers can carry around 29 ton (depends of the container size) it does not mean, that they are actually carrying this maximum payload. 

65.11 million tonnes have been transported in reefers in the year 2012 (Dekker, N., 2014, Global reefer trades - 2014, Drewry Maritime Research).

2.056 million TEU is the global capacity of reefers currently on operation (http://www.worldshipping.org/about-the-industry/containers/global-container-fleet, accessed 20141208).

The resulting utilization rate (related to maximum payload) is 0.15.

An diesel generator efficiency of 35.1% is assumed (see paramter comment).
